html:
ABUJA, Jan 27 (Reuters) - Nigerian stocks snapped a two-day winning streak on Thursday after investors sold shares of its biggest listed firm Dangote Cement DANGCEM.LG.

The main index .NGSEINDEX fell 1.1% to 46,009.23 points. On Wednesday, stocks rose to a level last seen in September 2008.

Dangote Cement shares closed at 260.60 naira, down 8.53% as investors booked profits following a company share buyback which pushed the price up last week. (Full Story)

A total of 18 companies declined while 26 advanced and more than a hundred recorded no trades.

Airtel Africa AIRTELAFRI.LG, with a dual listing in London AAF.L, remained at its all-time high of 1,271 naira hit on Wednesday after index manager FTSE Russell said the telecoms group will join the FTSE 100 on Monday.


(Reporting by Chijioke Ohuocha; Editing by Kirsten Donovan)

(( chijioke.ohuocha@thomsonreuters.com ; +234 703 4180 621; Reuters Messaging: chijioke.ohuocha.thomsonreuters@reuters.net ))
